newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil gains $2 on futures, premiums edge up.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil gains $2 on futures, premiums edge up.

text.p: NWE gas oil prices climbed $2 a tonne on Thursday due to gains on underlying IPE futures but premiums were unchanged.
Sellers of heating oil barges held around $1.50 a tonne over the IPE June contract and reported some interest close to $1.00 over.

Refiners said low premiums were encouraging them to trim output of 0.2 percent sulphur gas oil with Russian cargoes holding at just $3 a tonne over the screen. EN590 edged up 50 cents to about $11.50 a tonne over the screen for prompt while 1-15 June was nearer $11 and second half $10.50.
"We saw some good interest today but people just weren't ready to bite," said a seller.
Dealers said strong prices in the U.S. and some run cuts in Rotterdam had helped boost market confidence but many buyers were still reluctant to pay higher prices.
